wikipedia_page.main: Alice des Clayes (1890–1968) was a Scottish painter, sister to Berthe des Clayes. Born in Aberdeen. She studied at the Bushey School of Art with Lucy Kemp Welch,who specialized in painting horses; at Newlyn and at Ambleteuse with Dudley Hardy. She emigrated to Montreal Quebec in 1914. Alice des Clayes returned to England in 1938.Her work is included in the collections of the Musée national des beaux-arts du Québec and the National Gallery of Canada.
